physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Numerous fine, white, granular deposits in the right cornea; a few in the left eye.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially, a few granular deposits were observed; however, over time numerous deposits developed in both eyes.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Granular deposits were observed centrally in the interface beneath the flap of both eyes, more numerous in the right than the left eye.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Best spectacle-corrected visual acuity (BSCVA) was initially 20/20 in both eyes but declined to 20/30 in the right eye and 20/40 in the left eye.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Numerous fine, white, stromal granular deposits in the interface between the flap and residual stroma.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient noted progressive loss of vision two years after LASIK.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Numerous fine, white, granular deposits found in the right cornea; a few granular deposits in the left eye.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient's visual acuity was initially 20/20 in both eyes but eventually decreased.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Granular opacities present along the central flap interface of both eyes.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Visual acuity worsened from 20/20 before LASIK to 20/30 and then decreased to 20/50 in the right eye, and 20/200 in the left eye.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Numerous fine, white, anterior stromal granular deposits were observed in the interface between the corneal flap and residual stroma.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Left the cornea with clearer deposits initially, which worsened over the years.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: White granular opacities in the interface between the corneal flap and residual stroma observed.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: BSCVA improved to 20/20 after optical treatment but worsened again afterward.
